title: Control of directly connected appliances
fullText:
Every directly connected appliance in a recreational vehicle or non-recreational vehicle shall be controlled by a switch that is placed and marked so as to be readily identifiable and convenient for its intended use. This modifies the requirement of AS/NZS 3000 in relation to isolating devices for air conditioners, hot water services and fixed or stationary cooking appliances with an open cooking surface incorporating an electric cook top.
Where a dedicated circuit is installed to supply a single appliance, the protective device at the switchboard is deemed to comply.
Every directly connected appliance in a recreational vehicle or non-recreational vehicle shall be provided with a switch that operates in all live (active and neutral) conductors.
Exception: Where an isolating transformer or electricity converter with a polarized output, or a transposition sensor, is installed in accordance with Clause 2.6.4 for each external supply, the switches may operate in the active conductors only.
